data.op2: the views may be referenced in an SQL statement whenever tables are referenced
data.op3: the views are instantiated at the time they are referenced and not when they are defined
data.op4: the definition of a view should not have GROUP BY clause in it

data.question: Which of the following statement is not true about embedded SQL ?
data.op1: Embedded SQL expressions for database modification always returns a result.
data.op2: An embedded SQL program must be processed by a special processor prior to compilation.
data.op3: The exact syntax for embedded SQL request depends on the language in which SQL is embedded.
data.op4: In embedded SQL, all query processing is performed by the database system.

Transactions are initiated by BEGIN TRANSACTION and terminated :
data.op3: either by OMMIT TRANSATION or by ROLL BAK TRANSATION

data.question: Statement that uses a condition to control iterative execution of a statement block :
Complex calculations can be performed using the following operation :
An alias is :
data.op1: n alternate name given to a relation.
data.op2: An alternate name given to an inner query.
data.op3: An alternate name given to a user.

data.question: One of the main heuristic rule for query optimization :
data.op3: Applying a select and a Project first.

data.op1: When R and S are having at least one attribute common
data.op2: The degree of S is less than the degree of R
data.op3: The degree of R is less than the degree of S
data.op4: When R and S are having no attribute in common
